com.camerontec.util.io

Class BytesSegmentDataInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • com.camerontec.util.io.BytesSegmentDataInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, DataInput, AutoCloseable

    public final class BytesSegmentDataInputStream
extends InputStream
implements DataInput
    Specialized java.io.InputStream which uses a BytesSegment as its data source and also provides java.io.DataInput capabilities.

    This class is very similar to a java.io.DataInputStream, however, it differs in one major way - it is possible to layer on top of different BytesSegment instances without object creation via its wrap(BytesSegment) method.

    With the exception of the (deprecated) readLine() of java.io.DataOutput, which is not supported, this class behaves like a java.io.DataInputStream layered on top of a BytesSegmentInputStream.

      • readAsOverlay

        public int readAsOverlay(BytesSegment overlaySegment)
                  throws IOException
        Overlay the specified overlay segment over the remaining bytes in the stream.

        This is conceptually equivalent of having the specified overlay segment wrap all available bytes in the stream.

        This method simply delegates to BytesSegmentInputStream.readAsOverlay(BytesSegment).

        Parameters:
        overlaySegment - The overlay segment. Must not be null. On return the overlay segments byte array is the same as the stream's underlying byte array, its start position is set to the current position in the stream and its position is the number available bytes remaining in the stream.
        Returns:
        The number of available bytes in the stream, or -1 if no bytes are available.
        Throws:
        IOException - Here only to satisfy the available() contract - should never happen.
